meanings.definition: A large retail store combining a supermarket and a department store.
meanings.sent1: At the hypermarket, you can buy food and clothes in one place.
meanings.sent2: I need to pick up some groceries from the hypermarket after work.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tomato go to the hypermarket? To catch up with the salad dressing!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a hypermarket of ideas, with each aisle leading to a new discovery.
meanings.sent5: The hypermarket stood tall, a giant beacon of shopping opportunities.

meanings.definition: To shop at a hypermarket for groceries and household items.
meanings.sent1: Let's hypermarket this weekend to get everything we need for the party.
meanings.sent2: She hypermarkets every month to save time and money on shopping.
meanings.sent3: When he hypermarkets, he always ends up buying more snacks than planned.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the hypermarket aisles as she shopped with joy.
meanings.sent5: As she hypermarketed, the aisles seemed to stretch endlessly with possibilities.
